website_summaries.verdict: Though fast, the Portal has too many niggling issues that prevent it from being a seamless experience. Go with the Google Wifi or the Netgear Orbi instead.
pros: The Portal has fast speed and far-reaching Wi-Fi coverage
The system has both a web interface and a mobile app and doesn't require an account to work
cons: The web interface lacks some fairly typical Wi-Fi features and the mobile app is buggy
You can only use the app on a single mobile device
It requires you to change your settings in order for it to be compatible with all 5GHz devices
The system has terrible signal handoff

customer_reviews.title: The overall speed is better, and way more consistent
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I am surprised how much this improved my internet at home. The overall speed is better, and way more consistent. There is much better range, and I no longer have to deal with restarting my router all the time. When watching movies I don't have to wait for it to buffer every couple minutes any more. I highly recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Bug Guy

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs one of these routers!
customer_reviews.text: I loved the portal since it's easy to connect and use and is definitely much faster than most wireless routers. The packaging was great as it came protected in a plastic wrap since I received this on my doorstep on a rainy day I was glad it was packed with protection. It takes about one minute to setup and the connection speed is wonderful. Try it out, you really have nothing to lose. This is great for gamers and people who stream movies.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User 84

customer_reviews.title: Portal is Easy To Use!
customer_reviews.text: The portal router is extremely easy to set up! It's compatible with any modem that uses pretty much any internet service provider. Router also does a pretty good job with sustaining a strong connection. The mgb download/upload rate depends on the internet service you use and how fast your internet speed actually is! Aside from using it in conjunction with a modem, it also works with modem/router hybrids should you for whatever reason need to have separate wifi connection. Speaking of which, the wifi connection is password protected which is included with the Portal. No need to do a computer set up to get it password protected.
customer_reviews.author: Ramses T.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing performance!
customer_reviews.text: This router is amazing! It covers my entire house with a strong wifi signal. Since we cut the cord I have had trouble getting a consistent wifi signal at my TV and in some rooms of the house. I tried several different configurations of routers, bridges, extenders, power line ethernet all without success. I really came to hate it when I heard, "I can't login" or "the TV is out again". My son tried this and told me about it. He lives in a large apartment complex and was getting interference from his neighbor's wifi. His experience was the best endorsement I could get so I tried it. Calls to the family help desk have dropped 99.9% now.
customer_reviews.author: M. Strehlow

customer_reviews.title: Great product! My Internet speed doubled
customer_reviews.text: Great product! My Internet speed doubled. Streaming has never been so fast and it maximizes the speed of all the 6 devices connected. Watch the video for more.
customer_reviews.author: Giada Federici

customer_reviews.title: Finally a modern router with speed and simplicity
customer_reviews.text: I've been using netgear router for a over a couple of decades, and I finally found something modern in this genre. The boxing and hardware design is sleek! The installation process was super simple, the free app that you use to set it up makes the experience a lot smoother. No more digging through tabs and accessing your browser for cryptic local address and looking for admin password for updating/configuring the router. Also, I live in an apartment and Portal have seemed to have fixed the issue where other people's wifi signals get in my way. Not to mention I have dozens of devices and IoT devices that now connect to it.. Super fast and simple!
customer_reviews.author: Gomfucius

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product - it is no longer supported
customer_reviews.text: I paid $148 for my Portal in May of 2017. Out of nowhere, it ceased working. The app that is needed to operate it is no longer available in the iOSApp Store (I was not able to redownload it after updating my phone). There is no e-mail, telephone, chat or message board support. It feels like the company has gone out of business but leftover units are still being sold to unsuspecting buyers. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: D. Goldman

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend - particularly if you use Airplay or have WiFi devices like Hue lights
customer_reviews.text: Initially this was an improvement over our decade old WiFi router, with improved speed, even though we could not get Apple Airplay to work with it. After several months of use we started having WiFi drop outs and connection problems. We needed to reboot the router frequently. The wired internet devices still work fine through the cables plugged into the back of the router, but our Hue lights, access to the internet through WiFi, and other WiFi services are periodically unusable. Recently we pulled out our old WiFi router (a very old Airport Extreme) and set it back up as the family was cussing about the WiFi so often. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Pernie Porter

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Simple, and Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an Apple AirPort AP, circa 2011. When you have a working network, its easy to not recognize speed decreases until you push the bandwidth with streaming or other high bandwidth uses. Dropped in the Portal, enabled beamforming, turned off location sharing (no thank you), and off it went. One firmware update later and after changing the SSID and giving a secure password the Portal rocks. I tried an older iPAD, phones, and a Roku TV, and all seemed a little faster. Now I need to get another one to replace my other Airport. If nothing else the mantra out with the old, in with the new applies and the Portal is affordable and a solid choice.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C. Luster

customer_reviews.title: Constantly dropping internet connection to cable modem.
customer_reviews.text: I can't recommend this thing to anyone. I have the latest firmware in it and it is constantly (at least twice to three times a week) dropping it's wired connection to the cable modem. The only fix is manually cycling the power which is a pain in the butt. Worst router I've ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Sprockets

customer_reviews.title: Its great
customer_reviews.text: I have sometimes problems with my internet speed and wifi, its has been a huge problem. I have tried Portal for last couple days and things have changed really good! The difference has been great. I liked modern design and that Portal is very user friendly. easy to instal. Speeds are amazing and reliability of the connection has been great. I recommend to check it out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great router!
customer_reviews.text: Great router for a great price. I liked it for the following reasons: 1. Sleek/modern design, doesn't take up a lot of space 2. Easy setup and easy to use 3. Noticeably faster speeds than your average router I'm in a small space, usually with only 2-3 devices using wifi. I didn't experience any problems worth mentioning. I'm not an expert on routers by any means, but I do think the product is one worth trying!
customer_reviews.author: Lexi Loccisano

customer_reviews.title: A solution, finally!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router, and tried a couple speed tests. I was surprised with the results! I have an Apple Airport (which I thought was top of the line). I usually have trouble with my signal in my kitchen, only receiving about 11Mbps which I pay for 100Mbps. After switching to the Portal, i received my full 100Mbps that I pay for, even on the opposite side of my apartment! I recommend giving it a try if you have wifi issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob J.

customer_reviews.title: Good device / horrible app
customer_reviews.text: Device works well, but mobile app is horrible. I’d love to simply review the device, but you can’t separate the two. Not in 2018 - making adjustments via a browser vs the app are significantly different. The app is very basic and is very dated. Slow to update, limited power user functionality, and overall a clunky experience. I’m giving it 3 stars instead of 2 because I really do like the router, especially when compared to some other (very large and cumbersome looking) devices out there. Design is nice. Once Razer updates the app for this my review might change. Until then be ready to work a bit to get this setup.
customer_reviews.author: Yuumoushin

customer_reviews.title: Portal Review
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, I didn't think that I would notice a huge difference with the Portal Router. But boy was I wrong. I had previously had Asus and Linksys routers, and not really noticed a difference, but with the Portal Router, not only did I notice the speed but the strength was also fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: The product is extremely beautiful, modern
customer_reviews.text: I have used Linksys and Netgear routers all my life, this was the first time ever to use a brand. The product is extremely beautiful, modern, fast and reliable. The installation process was super easy. I enjoy streaming shows and movies, as well as gaming. In the past I would experience slowdown do to many devices connected and crowding the WiFi. Once I got Portal my life changed, it is extremely fast and beneficial if you have multiple devices to run at the same time. I am extremely happy with this product and would recommend it to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Kia

customer_reviews.title: Seemed great, didn't ultimately pan out
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router and used it for about 8 months before finally giving up. I had to constantly reset the router (sometimes up to twice a day) and was not successful in contacting customer support. The speeds were poor, even when I had strong signal. Ultimately I switched back to an old airport express before finally moving to a new Linksys router with which I'm very happy. Pros: Setup was simple, the interface and app were both clear and easy to use. Cons: It didn't work that well, constantly needed to be reset, and signal strength wasn't great.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Portal WiFi Router
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the router did what it was supposed to do and it improved my connectivity and slow speed issues. the only qualms i have is the lack of information available when the product arrives. I was not aware that i had to download an app to figure out how to use it let alone that i had to google search directions for the product because i was unsure of what to do with the product once it was received.
customer_reviews.author: J. N.

customer_reviews.title: Caveat emptor
customer_reviews.text: Great router, consistent high throughput until it died in less than a week and would not reboot no matter what I did. It did cut out a couple times before it just went red. Maybe I got a bum unit but caveat emptor. There may be a serious design flaw hidden somewhere in this thing. Routers shouldn’t just stop working.
customer_reviews.author: PDX-ish guy

customer_reviews.title: APARTMENT LIVING? BUY THIS!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worth EVERY penny. I get my internet through Xfinity/Comcast here in Oregon, and the services they provide are great...for everyone except people like me who live in an apartment complex. Before Portal, it was like I was racing with other tenants and their internet providers to get the fastest download speeds. It was a nightmare. Now, it's as if I have no interference at all! Let's put it this way... It's like when you're in last place on Mario Kart, and you're fighting everyone just to move up a place or two. But suddenly, you see a secret shortcut and bump yourself to first place. Portal is that secret shortcut.
customer_reviews.author: Alayna

customer_reviews.title: Strong network separation
customer_reviews.text: Mesh WiFi worked well enough, and it has the option to have the device plugged into the network via a wire. The interface was quick enough to setup with two devices. I really love the fact that you can create infinite separate WiFi networks. This is a huge security benefit if you have guests and internet of things devices that you want to keep separate if they get hacked.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hardin

customer_reviews.title: mesh was great while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Originally gave this product three stars for great performance, but a nasty DIY install experience that I had to guess my way through. Once I got the mesh WiFi working, I was really happy with it - for about 16 hours. Then both Portals (the new one, and the original Portal I was extending to mesh) went belly-up with red LEDs, and factory reset made no difference. Too bad, I really wanted to like this scrappy upstart router company, but engineering is key. This is home infrastructure, and it's gotta be in it for the long haul. Thanks to Amazon for their very reasonable return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew NW

customer_reviews.title: Better than ASUS AC68U AC-1900, Consistent UP/DOWN speed at 80MBP
customer_reviews.text: Worried about some of the negative reviews, but, based on a given cost, I ordered it and installed. Side by tests with ASUS AC68 and Fios Actiontech Giga routers. My service is about 75Mbps up/down. With a Portal: in the 1500sq space, I go consistent 80mbps or 10MB/sec, wifi signal was all 5-4 bars in three stories. With an ASUS AC68U, 30-80 Mbps DOWN, and about 20Mbps UP and only 5G connection at the very close range matched those of Portal. Signals were depended on the location, in ave. 3 bars With ActionTech, 34-37Mbps UP/Down
customer_reviews.author: smoon4

customer_reviews.title: Unlock your true internet speed!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical at first when I saw this on kickstarter. A wifi router that would unlock the full potential of my internet speed? Finally bought one on sale and as best decision ever! My internet speed has sky rocketed to its true speed. I have been paying for 50mbs but could never reach those speeds on the rental router. Max ever was 30. After using the portal hits 60mbs!!! That's more than I pay for. If you live in an apartment this is a must have if you want the speeds that you pay for. Also the router looks clean with the white shell almost like an apple product.
customer_reviews.author: Chao ChaoTop Contributor: Amiibo

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This router showed a lot of potential. The coverage is amazing and it supports a VPN configuration. The thing that makes it completely unusable however is that there is a bug in their DNS which causes a loopback and wastes a ton of bandwidth. The issue has been noted in their forums and supposedly fixed a while back but I have seen no evidence that that is the case. I'd highly recommend not purchasing one.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R Forman

customer_reviews.title: We live in a pretty dense neighborhood cluttered with competing wifi signals and our ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing keeps up with three adult heavy internet users/streamers. We live in a pretty dense neighborhood cluttered with competing wifi signals and our old router kept dropping speed. We updated our modem from the Comcast rental one to save on some cash and paired it with this router and things haven’t been the same. In our house there are often nights with all three of us streaming television and browsing the internet or gaming seamlessly. No more competing for bandwidth or signal. Really has been a great router. App could be better, but overall a really solid product. I just wish it was black and matte to blend in a little better with our decor.
customer_reviews.author: David Butler

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried several mesh Wi-Fi routers for my home and thus far this blows them away for coverage, stability and performance. Setup was easy for the basics but a little more complex for advanced setting as you have to use their web interface (not phone app) to do things like custom Wifi setting, DDNS, Port forwarding, etc and searching for information on the internet using the word “portal” and “router” really sucks. I think my biggest complaint is that they have picked too common on a word as the name of their company/product. Overall I’d recommend this product, especially if you are going to do a vanilla installation.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Mueller

customer_reviews.title: Best router for Apartments and Condos
customer_reviews.text: I've tried various wifi 6 routers and I couldn't get over 400Mbps (I have gigabit ethernet). This is the first router where I'm getting over 600mbps with my iphone/ipad. Great speeds and the coverage at my condo is better than ever. I bought two, but I don't even need the second one. I highly recommend this for the value, performance, design of the app and the model. I just wish I had heard about this product earlier. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: P. Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Great for buildings
customer_reviews.text: Works really well as a router and the wifi signal is strong. It does do a good job with finding the best channel and the The setup is easy and customer support is great. They are still adding new features and overall I've been impressed with the performance. UPnP was the latest feature added (10/16) and it works great. If you are considering a new router because the channels around you are congested; or if you are technologically challenged, this is the one you want. I supported this company on Kickstarter and was one of the initial people to get a Portal.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, disappointing execution
customer_reviews.text: Great concept but I was left disappointed with both the featureset and the support. There were some required features that most basic routers support including MAC filtering that this does not support. I contacted support and while they were friendly and prompt, after a couple messages they started ignoring me. As far as the router itself, the range is OK, but it is no better than a previous (much cheaper) router I had in its place. Also, since it lacks features from my previous router, it is a very poor purchase for the quality you get.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Duffey

customer_reviews.title: Good router, performs as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up. Router performs as advertised. We live in a condo building in an urban neighborhood, and no problems have come up in 3+ years. The only drawback would only be apparent to a minority of users. The interface does not provide as much flexibility or detailed controls as our former router (ASUS), but given our usage, this isn’t really a drawback.
customer_reviews.author: rico567

customer_reviews.title: Harmony in the home
customer_reviews.text: Did some research before ending up with this unit. This unit was by far the easiest setup I've every had. Download the APP, plug the unit in, reset the modem and you're in business. I have a 2 Story walkout, around 3200 SQ FT. I also have 4 WIFI cameras on the OUTSIDE perimeter of the house and the furthest camera from the router gets two bars of signal. So far no dead spots on any level and no more annoying reboots. Everyone is enjoying their Netflix and Ipads and phones on Wifi, and the cameras don't tell me they are disconnected all the time. I should have gotten this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley J.

customer_reviews.title: Not sure I'm getting all the features to work
customer_reviews.text: I may not be using it to its full potential but it does not seem any better than the tp-link it replaced. My home is a ranch and the wiring forced me to locate the router at the western end and the eastern end has trouble picking up the wifi signal. I have a centrally located extender from tp-link that does not seem to fix the problem either but I did succeed in getting the new router to work with it.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great speeds, perfect for city apartments
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my apartment where there are easily 30 networks my computer and phone can see, talk about saturation of networks! Previously I was using 2 different routers to try and boost my signal in my room (I have 100mbps internet), but only managed to get about 10mbps max with a small Netgear router, then hooked up an Asus and that delivered about 40-55mbps depending on time of day. Just set this up and I get 78mbps (of the 100mbps) to my room. I am absolutely blown away with how well this works. I was worried I'd need a repeater but this eliminated that need.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: ... was a bit sceptical about this router being as good as advertised but when I hooked it up to ...
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit sceptical about this router being as good as advertised but when I hooked it up to my modem and set it up (which was very easy after a few mins of updates) it did not let me down, it maxed my speeds out every test I ran, I have charter and the max download is around 60 and every test I ran was maxed out at 65, I booted up Netflix and put on “the punisher” in 4K and it needed no buffer time it loaded extremely fast. I got about 30-40 mbps with my old router and now I’m getting a consistent 65mbps!!! I am very satisfied with the portal!!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew W.

customer_reviews.title: Bulldozes through buffering; excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Works beautifully in my small, NYC apartment. Switching it out from my Airport Express made an immediate difference. It had gotten to the point where I could not make it through most streaming shows because of constant and relentless buffering. That is now a vanished memory -- I now even reliably get cable through a streaming app. The Portal ALWAYS works -- and it's beautifully designed as well. Setup was superb and easy -- (once I 'got it' that, hello, it needs to be set up through a cell phone -- not through my PC.) Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: June H

customer_reviews.title: Can't manually change chanel
customer_reviews.text: 2.4 & 5GHz wifi is always stock on the busiest channel and is no option to manual change channel. No phone support at all no changes to the website at. Only Community forum for support. I did not notice any updates to drive. I have filling like this router is made by ghosts. Only one this is good it's has a strong signal.
customer_reviews.author: JB USA

customer_reviews.title: Not for technically challenged
customer_reviews.text: Router may or may not function as described. I was unable to set the device up, primarily due to poorly written instructions and absolutely zero support. When help arrived, someone who knows this stuff, I was told this product is well beyond most user capabilities and I should seek a model with easier to set up interface.
customer_reviews.author: Merle W Craner

customer_reviews.title: with the little light on the "O" alphabet on a portal logo on the router the installation is super easy, and also connected with
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I want my wifi faster. Using 2 computers, and 3 phone devices, and Amazonfire for Netfilx at the same time makes my internet a little slow with this portal can help my wifi signal faster and greater performance for my home wifi. Plus the design is cute and modern look, with the little light on the "O" alphabet on a portal logo on the router the installation is super easy, and also connected with your phone! you can do it by yourself!
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Very nice router with easy set up!
customer_reviews.text: So far a very nice router. Set up was super easy. Was even able to set up port forwarding for my plex media server. Also simple and easy. Speeds so far have been really good. I currently live in colonial house so the top floor does lose some speed/signal strength but my last TrendNet (Dual Band) set up was the same. Down the road I plan on buying another portal to take care of that........can live with it for now. Currently have 13 devices hooked up to this and no problems. Very satisfied so far. Will update if things change!
customer_reviews.author: David Boudreau

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Router!
customer_reviews.text: I have installed dozens of these routers in many different homes and it has always performed very well. I have used the mesh network option by linking two of them together and I was able to get good internet signal throughout a three story 6000+ sq. ft. home (two is the max you can link together - I wish they would make it so you could do more). It's very easy to setup via bluetooth with a smartphone or via LAN with a computer.
customer_reviews.author: Brad B.

customer_reviews.title: Actually fast and easy to setup. Drown out your neighbors wifi!
customer_reviews.text: This is an honest, unpaid review. My tech guy at work recommended it to me. I can say it is the Easiest, most user friendly router I have ever used. Easy to link up with a 2nd for more coverage. The wifi signal is so strong, it drowns out my neighbors signal. I actually get the promised speeds I paid for with my internet (I average 220mbps download speed, 60 upload) over WiFi, not plugged in. It's incredible. Best bang for your buck for a normal high speed or moddest gaming router. You won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Alan C.

customer_reviews.title: Owned for 1 yr Constant Signal drop
customer_reviews.text: Is no better Signal Strength than my Modem from Spectrum. This router is more hype than anything else and does not live up to claims
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall quite a good router. Beautiful design
customer_reviews.text: Overall quite a good router. Beautiful design. My internet speeds have been quite satisfying. Although I have difficulty understanding what the specifications(802.11ac?) mean, the performance speaks for itself. Set up was easy as well. It also has several nice features such as smartphone apps (both Apple and android), USB ports, and parental controls. Finally, it's covered by a warranty so you won't have to worry about it breaking down earlier than it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Zane

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought several of these routers of the year for myself, family and friends. Living in an apartment this has been the best WiFi router because it find the best channel to put your WiFi on in a congested area. I highly recommend this router if you live an apartment as you will get the fastest speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: Missing key features
customer_reviews.text: As an access point it is fine. It does give you access to "FastLanes" which decrease contention on the 5ghz band. Unfortunately, the configuration interface lacks simple features such as choosing to reserve static ip addresses for devices. As this is a must have for me, this is an unacceptable replacement for my current access point and router. Unlike as stated in the comment below, the web access did not allow static reservations.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Ignition Design Labs PORTAL wifi router
customer_reviews.text: I need a wifi router that covers my house and out to my front gate so my new RING doorbell will have wifi. Portal replaced my previous Linksys wifi and extender that was weak. Portal is also the easiest EVER to hook up and work. I spent a day trying to get the previous wifi extender to work. Plug in Portsl, count to 10, it’s connected at about 6 ! It also looks better and no more falling floppy things hanging off it. Just a sleek look with a green light the size of a Cheerio.
customer_reviews.author: akHRprofessional

customer_reviews.title: No router is easier to connect.
customer_reviews.text: Just brought home a NightHawk X6 AC3000. Thinking its time for and upgrade. I've had the portal router since march 2017. Well after thoroughly testing the NightHawk and Portal. I think the portal wins.The NightHawk was a tiny bit better inside the home. And the portal was more then better outside on my porch. Or in the garage. Got the NightHawk onsale for $129.00. Its going back tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gregson

customer_reviews.title: Faster speed!
customer_reviews.text: Setup was relatively easy but it took a few tries to connect. After plugging everything in, you have to download the app and then use your phone to set up the router. It took three tries for my phone to connect, but after that, all the steps were easy to follow. I can definitely tell the Internet speed is faster, but I do wish that it also improved range.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase, used two on my 4ksf home. My son loves it for gaming as he is not lagging anymore. Had to bridge the unit on setup because we had to keep the old ATT router
customer_reviews.author: Jonc

customer_reviews.title: Noice
customer_reviews.text: I do not know why I thought this device was going to be small. It is not small nor cumbersome either. It is sleek and looks nice. I should have gotten the black one instead. It works and my Wi-Fi is fast and loose. Setting it up is a snap and I am happy. Now to get it daisy chained with my Norton Core [if that is even possible]. Everyone in NYC who has the money should get one. 8/27/17 UPDATE - Got a second one to set up a mesh network for overkill coverage in my outer borough home.
customer_reviews.author: ShinMadman3rd

customer_reviews.title: Great easy to use router.
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for quite a while now and it is better than the linksys and cisco routers I have had in the past. Good Wifi just about everywhere in the house and updates automatically. The phone app is a plus also letting you monitor who is on the network from anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: JMan 31337

customer_reviews.title: Alot of routers in your area... get this one.
customer_reviews.text: If you have see alot of wifi routers in your area you need to use this router. I have over 15 routers in my neighborhood and was constantly buffering and slow connections. Got this router and my speed is back to what i pay for and the buffering is almost not existent.
customer_reviews.author: Linuxjoe

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this thing! worthless..
customer_reviews.text: this product is terrible, would not recommend to anyone! does not work as advertised, I even bought a second one to expand my network and it did absolutely nothing.. now my "return window" is closed and I'm stuck with two of these expensive paper weights.. I went out and bought a different wireless router by Netgear and it's a million times better than this thing.
customer_reviews.author: David Barona

customer_reviews.title: Increased my internet speed 5-10X. Extremely impressive results
customer_reviews.text: I have had internet speed problems for over a year at this point. My ISP was promising 100mbps, and I had purchased another router rated to up to 500mbps to be safe, but I was only receiving 10-20mbps on average. After setting up the Portal wifi router, my internet speeds jumped to 100-150mbps. This device is sleek, easy to use with a great phone app and web portal, and can make a dramatic impact on your internet speeds. I can't recommend Portal highly enough. If you're facing variable and/or low performing speed issues, it's definitely the product for you! I'm attaching my speed results to this review from SpeedTest, so you can see the dramatic difference.
customer_reviews.author: Arcanius

customer_reviews.title: Portal: high performance without the clutter
customer_reviews.text: [Update] Power supply on the router went bad a little over half a year old. Reached out to Ignition for help/replacement with no response. Ordered my own aftermarket power supply to fix it myself. Router is working again and repaired, but a little disappointed now. Lowering review from 5 to 3 stars. [Original review] I was looking for 3 things in a router: 1. Excellent wireless performance 2. Gigabit wired capability for multiple media devices 3. Minimal space consumption (read: not 8 external antennas like my last bat-mobile router) Portal accomplished all 3 and has been running beautifully. Very happy with my purchase, reasonable price too.
customer_reviews.author: RedYoung

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product but there's always a room for improvement for everything
customer_reviews.text: The product does emit a much more powerful WiFi signal that my Verizon Fios Gateway Router and it does not live up to its claim of getting the same signal strength all over the house. It still is a monumental difference from my previous router. With that router I used to get a 20-30 Mbps internet speed while standing right next to it. With the portal wifi router, I get the full speed on wireless as I get on a wired connection. The manufacturer should probably think about putting in repeaters or a signal extender within the product for bigger houses.
customer_reviews.author: MSA

customer_reviews.title: Hands-down best wifi router on the market right now

I'm able to run streams to my 2 Tv's, 2 devices and 2 desktops at my apartment with 100 down from ISP with no issues at all. Easy to setup and the app is nice touch too which you can use to setup easy guest access if needed. Only downside is the short power cable but everything else is so good with Portal I didn't felt it dinged the score any.

customer_reviews.title: Product is still to new for the router industry
customer_reviews.text: The router disconnects on an avg of 3 times a week. Initially, it never recovered but reached out to support and they were great. I have an IT background so I worked with their tech's on improvements over a few months. They upgraded the router so it could recover from the ISP resets but the recovery is anywhere between 5-10 minutes, with some never recovering. I could no longer deal with the outages. Way too many. If you can handle outages and some complete disconnects then the product has great throughput and we stream everything so overall good from this standpoint. The customer service was great.

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says it does.

I found that in order to get the most of it, you have to adjust the settings according to your circumstances. Very easy to set up. Although, the app can be buggy at times. The app just needs to be updated to address the bugs. Overall, it is a solid router that I believe will be updated to become better with time.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and the best Router I have ever owned!!!! Portal you guys rock!!!

I have a 1550 sq ft home with a basement and no issues connecting in or around the house!!! Yes I centrally located this device. RECOMMEND I DO very much!!!

Maybe 75 ft circumference range. Way too expensive a device for such a lie.
customer_reviews.author: political idiot

The interface was fine and the device looks nice with the status light and no external antenna but the primary function of this is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Troy R. Gallipeau

customer_reviews.title: Work great at first.....
customer_reviews.text: Worked great the first few months then internet started getting spotty. Now it constantly needs to be reset. We can only connect to the guest network. I have contacted their support and it's been a week of troubleshooting the problem. My problem still has not been resolved.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful router
customer_reviews.text: The Portal is attractive as routers get, with a satin-white finish that doesn’t show fingerprints. This was the only router that solved both issues and gave me crystal clear WiFi through out my apartment. The router is also incredibly easy to set up. The app, however, could be better. It gets the job done, but can be a little buggy.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan De Cosmo

Also, you cannot disable the 2.4GHz wifi; if you remove the SSID it still broadcasts, just as an unnamed SSID. This is all fine if the Portal wifi router is the only wireless access point on your network but maddening if you have to administer multiple access points and have to shut down the device completely to test for interference on specific bands.

product_meta.title: Portal Mesh Wi-Fi Router – Reliable, high-performance wireless ready for gaming. Unique DFS Spectrum usage to eliminate congestion. Advanced Mesh Wi-Fi covers whole home.
product_meta.description:
Model:Single Pack 

Designed for tough urban environments. WiFi devices all share the same airwaves, and just like an old highway with not enough lanes, your internet slows to crawl whenever there are too many people and devices bottle-necking the same slow channels. Crowds also crush your range and coverage. Portal uses patented technologies that give your devices more WiFi bandwidth on exclusive fast channels to avoid speed-sucking range-crushing congestion; the result, consistently fast reliable internet, lag-free gaming and smooth ultraHD video streaming anywhere in your home. And Portal works with your existing network and all your favorite WiFi devices today. 



Key Features:

- Patented Multi-Channel Zero-Wait DFS enables exclusive use of special radar-protected channels, 3x more spectrum than conventional routers

- Powerful split-intelligence processor and innovative network self-optimization algorithms ensure consistent and reliable high-speed and wide area coverage.

- 10x state-of-the-art radios (802.11ac 5GHz, 802.11b/g/n 2.4GHz, Bluetooth Smart)

- 9x powerful, high-gain, power amplified, conformal antenna for maximum range and coverage

- 4x 10/100/1000 Mbps Ethernet Ports + 1x Gigabit WAN Port

- 2x USB 2.0 Ports

- Compatible with all IEEE 802.11 compliant devices

- Android and iOS application for smart configuration and setup

- Secure WebUI for traditional PC-based configuration and setup
feature_bullets: ZeroWait ZWDFS technology for lag-free gaming and streaming
Improved signal, reception and mesh network coverage
Connect up to 2 Portal WiFi Routers for range up to 6,000 sq. ft
